task.problem:
A man starts with four identical paper shapes - call these 4 of shape X. He carefully cuts, folds, and glues these instances of Shape X together to create a single hollow object. The process uses all of the paper without any waste.
The resulting 3D object has an interesting property: when viewed from any angle, its outline matches Shape X exactly.
What 3D object has the man created, and what is Shape X?
task.solution:
The area of a circle is given by the formula A =4πr^2, where r is the radius.
The surface area of a sphere is given by the formula A = 4πr^2, where r is the radius.
The outline of a sphere is a circle of the sphere's radius when viewed from any angle (thus a sphere of radius R has a circle of radius R as its outline).
Thus, Shape X is a circle, and the 3D object is a sphere.
